fact_check_explanation_title: The war on illiteracy and innumeracy has begun but what's the proper target?
fact_check_explanation_summary: As the Government launches its 'war on illiteracy and innumeracy' today, its own reading skills need some scrutiny.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Benefit Cap: Did it cause a "rush" to the job centre?
fact_check_explanation_summary: David Cameron has pledged to lower the benefit cap to £23,000 a year if he is re-elected. Does the evidence support his claim that the current £26,000 cap has caused …

fact_check_explanation_title: Factcheck: Simply wrong? Poor poverty figures at PMQs
fact_check_explanation_summary: During Prime Minister's Questions, an exchange on poverty led David Cameron to label Labour's numbers as 'simply wrong'. As ever, it's not quite that simple.

fact_check_explanation_title: Men accused of rape don't have to "prove that a woman said Yes"
fact_check_explanation_summary: New advice for prosecutors doesn't in any way change the law on rape.

fact_check_explanation_title: Public satisfaction with NHS at second-highest level in 30 years—but are we really happier?
fact_check_explanation_summary: NatCen says satisfaction with the NHS is up to 65% from 60% in 2013. Dissatisfaction is at its lowest level since Natcen's survey began 30 years ago.

fact_check_explanation_title: Factcheck: Can white teachers be discriminated against?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several newspapers, as well as the BBC, have reported on comments made by the Chief Inspector of Schools in England, suggesting that he supports "positive discrimination" in recruiting teachers.
